body:
I don't know what's going on in the past year or so, perhaps a reaction to the riots this summer and all the shit going on in recent months. But look at Joe Biden 40 years ago and all the "old Democrats" who were leftists with right-wing cultural beliefs and most of you sound exactly like them now.

What's happened is you abandoned freedom. What happened to small government, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, and the constitution? It seems you've become obsessed and fixated with nothing but beating the other side lately, and have been resorting to authoritarian means to do so. Are you even conservatives anymore? I wouldn't say so, because this new philosophy doesn't at all align with founding values.

Lately I've seen a lot of comments saying certain people should be banned from being able to hold office, serve in the military, or even be censored ([this thread ](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative/post/6ube/joe-biden-taps-transgender-official-as) alone has many examples). I've even seen a few complaining about how there's too much diversity and that's our problem (it used to be *forced* diversity that was complained about, because it's annoying PC crap). Even the sidebar of this guild says "no egalitarianism", which used to be one of the constitutional pillars for conservatives, "all men are created equal" (to clarify: in the sense of equality, not equity). Support for limited government, individual rights, equality under the law, and free markets is waning. None of this was happening until about a year ago. Up until then, conservatives could be defined as rooted in the moderately libertarian founding values of the USA, with some republic thrown in as necessary. That's definitely not true anymore. Many conservatives had strong beliefs but it was vital that they not be forced on others like the Democrats do, especially by the government. But now many of you want just that. If I had seen conservatives just 5 years ago I wouldn't even recognize you now. What the fuck happened? Are you trying to actually become what the media has been slandering you as for all these years?

Edit: See, this is another example of their censorship, the [+"Conservative"](https://ruqqus.com/+Conservative) guild kicked this post because it doesn't support their new alt ideology, even though it's in line with actual conservatism.

original_guild.description:
Conservative news, commentary, memes, and organizing information.

The term "conservative" comes from the Latin verb for "to conserve or preserve," and reflects the nature of conservatives as those who seek to preserve the best of human endeavor and nature throughout all of history, measuring it qualitatively to achieve excellence (*arete*) in defiance of the human tendency toward solipsism (*hubris*).

We include all conservatives from Republicans, paleoconservatives, monarchists, anarcho-monarchists, traditionalists, Nietzscheans, crunchy conservatives, Alt-Right, Ult Right, neoreactionaries, and social conservatives onward. No socialism or egalitarianism please.

* [Moderation guidelines](http://www.amerika.org/politics/ruqqus-conservative-moderation/)
* [FAQ](http://www.amerika.org/politics/ask-a-conservative/)

body:
For the longest time conservatism was *defined* by a belief in the constitution, states rights, small government, free speech, individual freedom, and free markets. In a nutshell it had the same idea as libertarianism, but more moderate and more oriented toward patriotism. I am a libertarian, and we used to be friends. But you've changed. This year conservatives have entirely abandoned their ideals, in favor of fascism, something they once strongly condemned as a socialist ideology (I don't mean Hitler when I say fascism, I just mean the general idea of authright). They think we need to enact tough laws on minorities, speech offensive to them, and basically all dissent. They're beginning to turn to anti-american forms of government such as monarchy and dictatorship as they believe things need to get under firm control and "return to tradition". Just in the past year, most of the media's accusations of them have gone from complete bullshit to true. When I asked a question about this in +Conservative, [I got exiled](https://ruqqus.com/+general/post/6w6x/exiled-from-conservative-for-disagreeing-with) because the person I disagreed with happened to be a guildmaster.

I have a theory. I think it's no wonder that conservatives have started to think this way after all the left's bullshit. And this year was especially bad.

![](https://i.imgur.com/Yxhawkb.jpg)

With all this political correctness bullshit, and all these tantrums, I think it's no wonder conservatives are starting to have negative thoughts towards the people the left is "defending". When they see black people, they are reminded of the "white privilege" fragility that caused BLM and Antifa riots this summer. Even though it's mostly white people doing it, seeing a black person now reminds them of this, and they are now associated with it. Nice going leftists. Same with small government, as many of the rioters falsely portrayed themselves as "anarchists" it made conservatives fear lack of government control and shy as far away from that as possible. Thanks to that there is now virtually no difference between "liber"al and "conservative", except culturally.

So yeah, you leftists have really made conservatives react and actually become fascist racist everything-phobics. And it's thanks to your tantrums and constant PC demands that caused them to associate them with your bullshit, and now they react accordingly. I suppose the deep state is happy though. The few real conservatives left and their libertarian friends are doomed. And with them, America.

They're beginning to turn to anti-american forms of government such as monarchy and dictatorship as they believe things need to get under firm control and "return to tradition". Just in the past year, most of the media's accusations of them have gone from complete bullshit to true. When I asked a question about this in +Conservative, I got exiled because the person I disagreed with happened to be a guildmaster.

I have a theory. I think it's no wonder that conservatives have started to think this way after all the left's bullshit. And this year was especially bad.

With all this political correctness bullshit, and all these tantrums, I think it's no wonder conservatives are starting to have negative thoughts towards the people the left is "defending". When they see black people, they are reminded of the "white privilege" fragility that caused BLM and Antifa riots this summer. Even though it's mostly white people doing it, seeing a black person now reminds them of this, and they are now associated with it. Nice going leftists. Same with small government, as many of the rioters falsely portrayed themselves as "anarchists" it made conservatives fear lack of government control and shy as far away from that as possible. Thanks to that there is now virtually no difference between "liber"al and "conservative", except culturally.

So yeah, you leftists have really made conservatives react and actually become fascist racist everything-phobics. And it's thanks to your tantrums and constant PC demands that caused them to associate them with your bullshit, and now they react accordingly. I suppose the deep state is happy though. The few real conservatives left and their libertarian friends are doomed. And with them, America.

We have half the brain women do and are less smart as a result, not to mention almost zero creative ability; there are way more male "geniuses" but only because men are pressured to succeed while the women are allowed to be lazy because men have to do everything for them. The top IQ on record is from a woman, and brain scans have shown their cognitive abilities to be superior even though they are nowhere near as cultivated. And despite our role as the physical laborer and fighter, our pain tolerance is actually lower, because nature doesn't give a shit about us, only what we do for society. We are to toil in hard labor and risky, painful situations while everyone else reaps the benefits of it. And fail or even express the slightest discontentment about it, and society punishes you. As a man, your life is literally supposed to be miserable, both socially and biologically. Men are biologically stripped of any ability to feel content or happy. We are pawns and slaves, and no one cares about us. We die younger, suck at everything but athletics, are miserable all the time, and basically are slaves. Your life is destined to be miserable and you have to like it. Men have basically nothing good going for themselves. Nature gave men the rough end of the deal, with the exception of a few thousand years where they got jealous and oppressed the women, and that didn't help men, it just made women miserable too. At least we're not honey bees. No wonder "women have more depression" even though far more men kill themselves. Because everyone feels bad and sees it as a problem if a girl is depressed, but boys are supposed to feel that way and be miserable and just accept it.

Fuck off feminazis. You haven't the first clue about what male "privilege" is. None. Our lives are slavery, and even now that we have the opportunity for more for the first time, we still are biologically designed to be worthless slaves and rarely capable of anything else. You don't realize how much we have to pay just to be able to lap you on a track and be obligated to awful duties no one wants to do. It's not a fair trade, and guess what? You didn't get the rough end of deal, men did.

body: And earth also still does revolve around the sun and spins and moves at the same time. This sounds complicated and contradictory but the explanation is simple. For any kind of movement you need a point of reference. Obviously that point will always be stationary with everything else moving in comparison to it. If that's the sun, then earth revolves around the sun and rotates, as does everything. However if it's earth, then the sun revolves around earth, as does everything. One isn't any more correct than the other, technically they're both true depending on what your point of reference is. The main star is simply the most logical choice because it's central to nearly all solar systems, and it's the simplest model with which to explain gravity and different forces that the star plays a major role in for all objects in the solar system. This is why we don't feel the earth spinning or moving through space, because our point of reference is ourselves, who are on earth, and therefore from our perspective the earth is geocentric. But if we were on the sun, it would be solarcentric. When you get on a merry-go-round, it doesn't move at all, the world around it does and you can only tell it's the merry-go-round that's moving because of wind and air resistance. But when you're in the outside world the merry-go-round moves and the world stays the same. There's no grand central point of space we're comparing anything to absolutely, it all depends on perspective, and we've chosen the sun because it's the best one to use for science.

body:
Currently most successful people are men. So are the least. The current consensus is that the average intelligence for both sexes is the same, but males are more variable than females.

I call that bull. I think the entire intelligence curve for females is simply shifted to the right of males. In every single hard class at high school and university level, there are far more boys but the handful of girls are always at the top of the class, easily solving problems that stump the hell out of the boys. It's the same at any non-blue-collar workplace, there are more male employees overall but the female minority does a better job, is more productive, and comes up with more ideas. All across the board it's been shown that girls are substantially better learners than boys, and have sharper and more active minds. Girls also have a *significant* advantage in the arts, languages, music, humanities, even just simple functions like memory and emotion. While still having a slight advantage even in "male" subjects like STEM. Pretty much anything involving designing or creating, even simple outside the box thinking, females are naturally going to be way better. Males commit suicide 3.5x more despite supposedly having less depression (I suspect it's actually because depression is biologically hardwired into males so is rarely taken seriously for them, in fact "whining" about it is usually punished).

It's not just stereotypes and observational evidence though. Brain scans back this up too. Female brains are typically a bit smaller, but so was Einstein's. Female brains have denser neurons that more than make up for it, and their hippocampus and cortices are all larger and wired much more efficiently than in males, which correlates to higher cognitive ability. Not only that, but it's been shown that males pretty much exclusively use the left side of their brain (logical, stoic, rational, logical, and blunt) while females are capable of using both sides. This is why men are usually so uncreative, unemotional (except for anger), unartistic, unsympathetic, and lack even the most basic intuition and feeling. Pretty much the only thing males excel at in the mental realm is spatial awareness. And even then, only in the real physical world; females are still usually superior at crafting, designing, and drawing shapes and 3d perspectives. This also makes biological sense. Think back to ancient times, when male was the more "disposable" sex that was constantly sent into risky and brutal situations, fighting, mating, and laboring, while the females engaged more in homemaking, childrearing, and organizing society. You don't need much of a brain to do the former, and with so many resources devoted to it, males lose a lot of other capabilities. Men are pretty much smarter as children than they are as adults! Why do you think Homer Simpson is so familiar? This explains some other things too, like why men die younger and feel pain worse despite having to endure more painful situations.

So why are some men still more successful and have higher IQs? My theory is societal expectations. From the moment they enter school, boys MUST succeed, do what they're told, and do it *extremely* well or there will be consequences. Girls are usually given a lot more slack. Boys are expected to have careers and become independent, whereas girls are allowed to leech off of them their whole lives, and allowed to run to someone else crying for help with every tiny thing that doesn't go their way. So what happens is that only the ambitious girls end up cultivating their skills. And when they do, the results are amazing. But obviously the people who actually *want* to pursue things instead of being lazy are the minority of the population. If you pick out 10 geniuses, chances are 9 of them will be boys but the one girl will be smarter than half of them combined. She will usually be multi-talented, easy to work with, have a lot of ideas, well-rounded and brilliant. Top IQs reflect this, in which they are almost all males but the #1 spot goes to a female. If most females would put down the makeup and snapchat and become interested in something actually productive like the males are made to do, I think their intelligence would improve quite drastically. But we instead encourage that hyper "girly" behavior which doesn't accomplish anything except make it even harder for the sexes to understand each other than it already would be. Boys are far too neglected and girls are way too coddled. It doesn't make any sense to have lower expectations for the ones with higher potential. I think there needs to be a serious shift in raising girls to become productive persons rather than docile crybabies. They'd be happier and have more fun that way too.

body:
The pastoral epistles, known by most as 1 & 2 Timothy and Titus, were not written by Paul but forged in his name by the church fathers who sought to combat an early heretic named Marcion. Marcion insisted on a literal interpretation of the old testament and believed that the creator was an evil tyrant separate from the father of Christ. He and his followers were vegans, did not procreate, and had all kinds of ridiculous rules and teachings (ironic given their gripe about the old testament). Marcion also said Paul was the only apostle.

Unfortunately the church became reactionary and instead of being honest wrote these epistles for Paul to disprove Marcion. The entirety of the pastorals reads like a summary of Marcionism:

* False teachers

* False teachers are forbidding eating certain foods and marriage (Marcionite veganism and anti-procreation) (1 Timothy 4:3)

* Seeking marriage is commanded and procreation and Roman family structure is the most central part of life. In fact, bearing children is even set as a requirement for salvation (1 Timothy 2:15).

* Women must be silent and submissive housewives and mothers (lots of women were high up in Marcion's assembly)

* The law is portrayed in a very positive light and good works are essential (Marcion did not think highly of the OT law)

* Uses the "shipwreck" analogy (Marcion was a ship trader).

* Complains about "jewish myths" constantly (Strange as it sounds, Marcion was accused of being a Judaizer for his interpretation of the OT).

* The pastorals seem to teach the idea that Jesus was merely a man mediating for the OT God (to contrast with Marcion's belief that the OT God was separate from Christ's) (1 Timothy 2:5)

We know that Marcion was in error about a great many things. However it seems that the early church was more concerned with defeating their enemies than being honest. Instead, they wrote the pastoral epistles in the name of Marcion's favorite apostle, which simply proclaim everything the opposite of Marcion. This reactionary nature does not accurately represent Paul, so any attempt to claim it was one of his students writing for him does not stand. While Paul clearly disagreed with Marcion in many ways, in any case where Paul *does* agree with Marcion the pastorals disagree with him in order to disagree with Marcion:

* Real Paul never frowned upon marriage as did Marcion, but commended the unmarried as having done better, opposite of the pastoral theology (1 Corinthians 7)

* Real Paul believed the OT law to be a stumbling block which leads to sin. It was fulfilled and freedom in Christ is emphasized.

* Real Paul was not hesitant to hold women high regard or employ them in high positions (Romans 16)

* Real Paul concerned himself not with the things of this world, but the next, assuring that this one is only a vapor in time and does not matter. "Paul" of the pastorals however was primarily concerned with conforming to Greco-Roman social norms, marriage & procreation, organized church structure, and the affairs of this life.

I would not advise putting much trust in the pastoral epistles. They were not from a faithful follower but some reactionary church father. They teach several other problematic commands, such as abandoning widows and possibly even condoning slavery.

  • The law is portrayed in a very positive light and good works are essential (Marcion did not think highly of the OT law)

  • Uses the "shipwreck" analogy (Marcion was a ship trader).

  • Complains about "jewish myths" constantly (Strange as it sounds, Marcion was accused of being a Judaizer for his interpretation of the OT).

  • The pastorals seem to teach the idea that Jesus was merely a man mediating for the OT God (to contrast with Marcion's belief that the OT God was separate from Christ's) (1 Timothy 2:5)

We know that Marcion was in error about a great many things. However it seems that the early church was more concerned with defeating their enemies than being honest. Instead, they wrote the pastoral epistles in the name of Marcion's favorite apostle, which simply proclaim everything the opposite of Marcion. This reactionary nature does not accurately represent Paul, so any attempt to claim it was one of his students writing for him does not stand. While Paul clearly disagreed with Marcion in many ways, in any case where Paul does agree with Marcion the pastorals disagree with him in order to disagree with Marcion:

  • Real Paul never frowned upon marriage as did Marcion, but commended the unmarried as having done better, opposite of the pastoral theology (1 Corinthians 7)

  • Real Paul believed the OT law to be a stumbling block which leads to sin. It was fulfilled and freedom in Christ is emphasized.

  • Real Paul was not hesitant to hold women high regard or employ them in high positions (Romans 16)

  • Real Paul concerned himself not with the things of this world, but the next, assuring that this one is only a vapor in time and does not matter. "Paul" of the pastorals however was primarily concerned with conforming to Greco-Roman social norms, marriage & procreation, organized church structure, and the affairs of this life.

I would not advise putting much trust in the pastoral epistles. They were not from a faithful follower but some reactionary church father. They teach several other problematic commands, such as abandoning widows and possibly even condoning slavery.

body:
The pastoral epistles, known to most as 1 & 2 Timothy and Titus, were not written by Paul but forged in his name by the church fathers who sought to combat an early heretic named Marcion. Marcion insisted on a literal interpretation of the old testament and believed that the creator and old testament god was an evil tyrant and lesser god opposed to the father of Christ. He and his followers were vegans, did not procreate, and had all kinds of ridiculous rules (ironic given their gripe about the old testament). Marcion also said Paul was the only apostle.

Unfortunately the church became reactionary and instead of being honest wrote these epistles for Paul to disprove Marcion. The entirety of the pastorals reads like a summary of Marcionism:

* False teachers are forbidding eating certain foods and marriage (Marcionite veganism and anti-procreation) (1 Timothy 4:3) "[false teachers] forbidding to marry, to abstain from foods which God created for use with thankfulness by the faithful and knowing of the truth"

* Seeking marriage is commanded and procreation and Roman family structure is the most central part of life, and church officials must both be husbands and have well-liked children (1 Timothy 3:4-5, Titus 1:5-6). In fact, bearing children is even set as a requirement for salvation (1 Timothy 2:15) "But [women] will be saved by the bearing of children...".

* Women must be silent and submissive housewives and mothers (lots of women were high up in Marcion's assembly) (1 Timothy 2:11-2:14, 1 Timothy 5:14 and several other passages)

* The law is portrayed in a very positive light and good works are essential (Marcion did not think highly of the OT law)

* Uses the "shipwreck" analogy (and Marcion was a ship trader) (1 Timothy 1:19).

* Complains about jewish myths constantly (Strange as it sounds, Marcion was called a Judaizer by the church fathers for his interpretation of the OT).

* The pastorals seem to teach the idea that Jesus was merely a man mediating for the OT God (to contrast with Marcion's belief that the OT God was separate from Christ's) (1 Timothy 2:5) "For there is one God, and one mediator of God and men, the MAN Anointed Jesus"

We know that Marcion was in error about a great many things. However it seems that the early church was more concerned with defeating their enemies than being honest. Instead, they wrote the pastoral epistles in the name of Marcion's favorite apostle, which simply proclaim everything the opposite of Marcion. This reactionary nature does not accurately represent Paul, so any attempt to claim it was one of his students writing for him does not stand. While Paul clearly disagreed with Marcion in many ways, in any case where Paul *does* agree with Marcion the pastorals disagree with him in order to disagree with Marcion:

* Real Paul never frowned upon marriage as did Marcion, but commended the unmarried as having done better, opposite of the pastoral theology (1 Corinthians 7)

* Real Paul believed the OT law to be a stumbling block which leads to sin. It was fulfilled and freedom in Christ is emphasized (Romans 7).

* Real Paul was not hesitant to hold women high regard or employ them in high positions (Romans 16)

* Real Paul concerned himself not with the things of this world, but the next, assuring that this one is only a vapor in time and does not matter. "Paul" of the pastorals however was primarily concerned with conforming to Greco-Roman social norms, marriage & procreation, organized church structure, and the affairs of this life. Some of it appears to be developing Catholicism.

I would not advise putting much trust in the pastoral epistles. They were not from a faithful follower but some reactionary church father. They teach several other problematic commands, such as abandoning widows (1 Timothy 5) and possibly even condoning slavery (1 Timothy 6:1-2, but the language is unclear). "Peter's" epistles and Jude and James (which teaches a works salvation btw) are probably counterfeits as well. Ephesians, Colossians, 2 Thessalonians, and most of the non-Pauline epistles all have a good chance of not being authentic, and possibly even Revelation. Of course we could also just follow Jesus instead of men and this wouldn't be much of a problem in the first place.

body: At least for the past few months, everywhere I go on ruqqus people seem to have a huge fetish for men being "men" and dominating their women. I don't really care but it seems to prevail almost universally on ruqqus for some reason, in a manner similar to how almost everyone on deviantart and twitter is a furry. It can become annoying when it begins to invade serious discussion though. For instance I just saw a post complaining that female soldiers exist. People often even express disappointment that girls sports are a thing. And any time someone suggests that women beat men in anything, the bandwagon attacks it and insists otherwise with zero evidence but their kink. It seems like ruqqus is obsessed with the female being weak and dominated by the male, to the point where they think the whole world should be set up and legislated to reflect their fetish. This isn't abnormal (though to the degree of wanting to impose it on everyone is) but I wonder why it's so prevalent here? There are obvious reasons why art sites tend to attract furries and weebs, but I'm confused about how discussion forums attract "alpha males" so much.
